intro: Tithymalus crebrifoliatus, commonly known as the dense-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are densely arranged along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Tithymalus crebrifoliatus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
